diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cholelithiasis with acute on chronic cholecystitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the patient's symptoms of right upper quadrant abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. The abdominal ultrasound findings showed numerous gallstones in the gallbladder neck with wall thickening and mural edema, which are indicative of acute on chronic cholecystitis.
